ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I improved my speaking, reading and writing skills and learned more about Chinese history
In this course, my chinese speaking, writing, and reading skills were greatly improved.
A better understanding and mastery of the Chinese language, especially vocabulary to talk about social issues
Advanced Chinese vocabulary and grammar structures

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: discussion-based, the professor is engaging and enthusiastic

Weaknesses: some of the topics are sensitive topics (e.g. weight, divorce) but I think the professor handles it well. I would prefer async day to be on Friday rather than be in the middle of the week just because this class is so intensive in terms of outside class work. I wish it focused more on writing rather than speaking.  Class time is already dedicated to speaking so I wish projects were more focused on writing (not typing and presenting)
The strengths of the course were the classes and discussions. The weaknesses of the course include the presentations and can be improved by different topics.

Strengths include small class sizes and step by step content teaching (well paced, unit tests and no finals). Once a week asych classes are also a plus. Weakness may be that sometimes the format could get repetitive.

Very well organized, and the calendar is very helpful for keeping track of deadlines. Additionally, Liu Laoshi is very understanding and caring about both the intellectual development and well-being of her students.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: yes, good intensive course to improve Chinese
Yes, it is a great way to advance one's Chinese skills
